data

Class ClackData

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.ClackData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileClackData, MessageClackData

    public abstract class ClackData
extends java.lang.Object
    Class ClackData is a superclass that represents the data sent between the client and the server. An object of type ClackData consists of the username of the client user, the date and time at which the data was sent and the data itself, which can either be a message (MessageClackData) or the name and contents of a file (FileClackData). Note that ClackData should not be instantiable.
    Author:
    xinchaosong

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CONSTANT_LISTUSERS
      For giving a listing of all users connected to this session.
      static int CONSTANT_LOGOUT
      For logging out, i.e., close this client's connection.
      static int CONSTANT_SENDFILE
      For sending a file.
      static int CONSTANT_SENDMESSAGE
      For sending a message.
      protected java.util.Date date
      A Date object representing the date and time when ClackData object is created.
      protected int type
      An integer representing the kind of data exchanged between the client and the server.
      protected java.lang.String userName
      A string representing the name of the client user.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClackData()
      The default constructor.
      ClackData(int type)
      The constructor to create an anonymous user, whose name should be "Anon".

      The constructor to set up the instance variable username and type.

      • ClackData

        public ClackData(java.lang.String userName,
                 int type)
        The constructor to set up the instance variable username and type. The instance variable date should be created automatically here.
        Parameters:
        userName - a string representing the name of the client user
        type - an int representing the data type

      • ClackData

        public ClackData(int type)
        The constructor to create an anonymous user, whose name should be "Anon". This constructor should call another constructor.
        Parameters:
        type - an int representing the data type

      • ClackData

        public ClackData()
        The default constructor. This constructor should call another constructor. type should get defaulted to CONSTANT_LOGOUT.
